org.apache.directory.server.dhcp.service

Class AbstractDhcpService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.directory.server.dhcp.service.AbstractDhcpService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DhcpService
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LeaseManagerDhcpService

    public abstract class AbstractDhcpService
extends Object
implements DhcpService
    Abstract implementation of the server-side DHCP protocol. This class just provides some utility methods and dispatches server-bound messages to handler methods which can be overridden to provide the functionality.

    Client-bound messages and BOOTP messages are ignored.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.apache.directory.server.dhcp.service.DhcpService

      • getRemoteAddress

        @Nonnull
public static InetAddress getRemoteAddress(@Nonnull
                                   InterfaceAddress localAddress,
                                   @Nonnull
                                   DhcpMessage request,
                                   @CheckForNull
                                   InetSocketAddress clientAddress)
                                    throws DhcpException
        Determine address on which to base selection. If the relay agent address is set, we use the relay agent's address, otherwise we use the address we received the request from.
        Parameters:
        clientAddress - The remote address of the socket the request came in over.
        request -
        Returns:
        InetAddress
        Throws:
        DhcpException

      • newReply

        @Nonnull
public static DhcpMessage newReply(@Nonnull
                           InterfaceAddress localAddress,
                           @Nonnull
                           DhcpMessage request,
                           @Nonnull
                           MessageType type)
        Initialize a general DHCP reply message. Sets:
        • op=BOOTREPLY
        • htype, hlen, xid, flags, giaddr, chaddr like in request message
        • hops, secs to 0.
        • server hostname to the hostname appropriate for the interface the request was received on
        • the server identifier set to the address of the interface the request was received on
        Parameters:
        localAddress -
        request -
        Returns:
        DhcpMessage
